description.compact: Set this to true on your sub-class to disable the use of themes in this test.

docblock.description: This can be handy for functional testing of modules without having to worry about whether a user has changed behaviour by replacing the theme.

description.compact: Set this to true on your sub-class to use the draft site by default for every test in this class.
CSSContentParser for the most recently requested page.
If this is true, then 30x Location headers will be automatically followed.

docblock.description: If not, then you will have to manaully call $this->mainSession->followRedirection() to follow them. However, this will let you inspect the intermediary headers

description.compact: Returns the {@link Session} object for this test

comment.value: Skip calling FunctionalTest directly.
Disable theme, if necessary
Switch to draft site, if necessary
Unprotect the site, tests are running with the assumption it's off. They will enable it on a case-by-case

description.compact: Run a test while mocking the base url with the provided value

param.description: The base URL to use for this test
The test to run

description.compact: Run a test while mocking the base folder with the provided value

param.description: The base folder to use for this test
The test to run

description.compact: Submit a get request
Submit a post request
Submit the form with the given HTML ID, filling it out with the given data.

docblock.description:
Acts on the most recent response.
Any data parameters have to be present in the form, with exact form field name and values, otherwise they are removed from the submission.
Caution: Parameter names have to be formatted as they are in the form submission, not as they are interpreted by PHP. Wrong: array('mycheckboxvalues' => array(1 => 'one', 2 => 'two')) Right: array('mycheckboxvalues[1]' => 'one', 'mycheckboxvalues[2]' => 'two')

param.description: HTML 'id' attribute of a form (loaded through a previous response)
HTML 'name' attribute of the button (NOT the 'id' attribute)
Map of GET/POST data.

description.compact: Return the most recent content
Find an attribute in a SimpleXMLElement object by name.

param.description: Name of attribute to find

description.compact: Return a CSSContentParser for the most recent content.
Assert that the most recently queried page contains a number of content tags specified by a CSS selector.

docblock.description:
The given CSS selector will be applied to the HTML of the most recent page. The content of every matching tag will be examined. The assertion fails if one of the expectedMatches fails to appear.
Note:   characters are stripped from the content; make sure that your assertions take this into account.

param.description: A basic CSS selector, e.g. 'li.jobs h3'
The content of at least one of the matched tags

description.compact: Assert that the most recently queried page contains a number of content tags specified by a CSS selector.

docblock.description:
The given CSS selector will be applied to the HTML of the most recent page. The full HTML of every matching tag will be examined. The assertion fails if one of the expectedMatches fails to appear.
Note:   characters are stripped from the content; make sure that your assertions take this into account.

param.description: A basic CSS selector, e.g. 'li.jobs h3'
The content of *all* matching tags as an array

description.compact: Assert that the most recently queried page contains a number of content tags specified by a CSS selector.

docblock.description:
The given CSS selector will be applied to the HTML of the most recent page. The content of every matching tag will be examined. The assertion fails if one of the expectedMatches fails to appear.
Note:   characters are stripped from the content; make sure that your assertions take this into account.

param.description: A basic CSS selector, e.g. 'li.jobs h3'
The content of at least one of the matched tags

description.compact: Assert that the most recently queried page contains a number of content tags specified by a CSS selector.

docblock.description:
The given CSS selector will be applied to the HTML of the most recent page. The full HTML of every matching tag will be examined. The assertion fails if one of the expectedMatches fails to appear.
Note:   characters are stripped from the content; make sure that your assertions take this into account.

param.description: A basic CSS selector, e.g. 'li.jobs h3'
The content of *all* matched tags as an array

description.compact: Log in as the given member

param.description: ID, fixture codename, or Member object of the member that you want to log in

description.compact: Use the draft (stage) site for testing.

docblock.description: This is helpful if you're not testing publication functionality and don't want "stage management" cluttering your test.

param.description: toggle the use of the draft site

description.compact: Return a static variable from this class.
Path to fixture data for this test run.

docblock.description: If passed as an array, multiple fixture files will be loaded. Please note that you won't be able to refer with "=>" notation between the fixtures, they act independent of each other.

var.description: Set whether to include this test in the TestRunner or to skip this.
If set to TRUE, this will force a test database to be generated

docblock.var: in . Note that this flag is overruled by the presence of a , which always forces a database build.

description.compact: Pointer to the manifest that isn't a test manifest
By default, setUp() does not require default records. Pass class names in here, and the require/augment default records function will be called on them.
A list of extensions that can't be applied during the execution of this run. If they are applied, they will be temporarily removed and a database migration called.

docblock.description: The keys of the are the classes that the extensions can't be applied the extensions to, and the values are an array of illegal extensions on that class.

description.compact: A list of extensions that must be applied during the execution of this run. If they are not applied, they will be temporarily added and a database migration called.

docblock.description: The keys of the are the classes to apply the extensions to, and the values are an array of required extensions on that class. Example: array("MyTreeDataObject" => array("Versioned", "Hierarchy"))

description.compact: By default, the test database won't contain any DataObjects that have the interface TestOnly.

docblock.description: This variable lets you define additional TestOnly DataObjects to set up for this test. Set it to an array of DataObject subclass names.

description.compact: We need to disabling backing up of globals to avoid overriding the few globals SilverStripe relies on, like $lang for the i18n subsystem.
Cache for logInWithPermission()
Determines if unit tests are currently run (via {@link TestRunner}).

docblock.description: This is used as a cheap replacement for fully mockable state in certain contiditions (e.g. access checks). Caution: When set to FALSE, certain controllers might bypass access checks, so this is a very security sensitive setting.

description.compact: Set the manifest to be used to look up test classes by helper functions
Return the manifest being used to look up test classes by helper functions

comment.value: We cannot run the tests on this abstract class.
Mark test as being run
i18n needs to be set to the defaults or tests fail
Set default timezone consistently to avoid NZ-specific dependencies
Remove password validation
Set up email

todo.value: this could be a special test model

comment.value: Set up fixture
echo "Re-creating temp database... ";
Support fixture paths relative to the test class, rather than relative to webroot
String checking is faster than file_exists() calls.
backwards compatibility: Load first fixture into $this->fixture
Preserve memory settings
turn off template debugging
Clear requirements

description.compact: Called once per test case ({@link SapphireTest} subclass).

docblock.description: This is different to , which gets called once per method. Useful to initialize expensive operations which don't change state for any called method inside the test, e.g. dynamically adding an extension. See for tearing down the state again.

comment.value: Remove any illegal extensions that are present
Add any required extensions that aren't present
If we have made changes to the extensions present, then migrate the database schema.
clear singletons, they're caching old extension info
which is used in DatabaseAdmin->doBuild()
Set default timezone consistently to avoid NZ-specific dependencies

description.compact: tearDown method that's called once per test class rather once per test method.

comment.value: If we have made changes to the extensions present, then migrate the database schema.
Remove extensions added for testing
Reapply ones removed

description.compact: Get the ID of an object from the fixture.

param.description: data class, as specified in your fixture file. Parent classes won't work
identifier string, as provided in your fixture file

description.compact: Return all of the IDs in the fixture of a particular class name.

docblock.description: Will collate all IDs form all fixtures if multiple fixtures are provided.

description.compact: Get an object from the fixture.

param.description: The data class, as specified in your fixture file. Parent classes won't work
The identifier string, as provided in your fixture file

description.compact: Load a YAML fixture file into the database.

docblock.description: Once loaded, you can use idFromFixture() and objFromFixture() to get items from the fixture. Doesn't clear existing fixtures.

param.description: location of the .yml fixture file, relative to the site base dir

description.compact: Clear all fixtures which were previously loaded through {@link loadFixture()}
Useful for writing unit tests without hardcoding folder structures.

comment.value: Preserve memory settings
Restore email configuration
Restore password validation
Restore requirements
Mark test as no longer being run - we use originalIsRunningTest to allow for nested SapphireTest calls
Reset mocked datetime
Stop the redirection that might have been requested in the test.
Note: Ideally a clean Controller should be created for each test.
Now all tests executed in a batch share the same controller.

description.compact: Clear the log of emails sent
Search for an email that was sent.

docblock.description: All of the parameters can either be a string, or, if they start with "/", a PREG-compatible regular expression.

description.compact: Assert that the matching email was sent since the last call to clearEmails() All of the parameters can either be a string, or, if they start with "/", a PREG-compatible regular expression.
Assert that the given {@link SS_List} includes DataObjects matching the given key-value pairs. Each match must correspond to 1 distinct record.

param.description: patterns to match. Each pattern is a map of key-value pairs. You can

docblock.param: either pass a single pattern or an array of patterns.

param.description: {@link SS_List} to test.

comment.value: Remove it from $extracted so that we don't get duplicate mapping.
We couldn't find a match - assertion failed

description.compact: Assert that the given {@link SS_List} includes only DataObjects matching the given key-value pairs. Each match must correspond to 1 distinct record.

param.description: patterns to match. Each pattern is a map of key-value pairs. You can

docblock.param: either pass a single pattern or an array of patterns.

param.description: {@link SS_List} to test.

docblock.param: Example -------- Check that *only* the entries Sam Minnee and Ingo Schommer exist in $members. Order doesn't matter: $this->assertDOSEquals(array( array('FirstName' =>'Sam', 'Surname' => 'Minnee'), array('FirstName' => 'Ingo', 'Surname' => 'Schommer'), ), $members);

comment.value: Remove it from $extracted so that we don't get duplicate mapping.
We couldn't find a match - assertion failed
If we have leftovers than the DOS has extra data that shouldn't be there

description.compact: Assert that the every record in the given {@link SS_List} matches the given key-value pairs.

param.description: pattern to match. The pattern is a map of key-value pairs.
{@link SS_List} to test.

docblock.param: Example -------- Check that every entry in $members has a Status of 'Active': $this->assertDOSAllMatch(array('Status' => 'Active'), $members);

be reset whenever the database is killed

be reset whenever the database is cleaned out

Reinstate PHPUnit error handling
